title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement murielle@thinkr.fr. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Check data
code: check_plus_in_primary_fur_color(primary_fur_color = c("Black", "Black+Cinnamon", "Cinnamon", NA)) #> [1]  TRUE FALSE  TRUE    NA

title: Check data
code: both_valid_latitude <- c(40.766, 40.799) both_valid_longitude <- c(-73.96, -73.95) both_invalid_latitude <- c(30, 32) both_invalid_longitude <- c(-100, -99) one_invalid_latitude <- c(40.766, 50) one_invalid_longitude <- c(-73.95, -100)  check_coordinates(   latitude = both_valid_latitude,   longitude = both_valid_longitude ) #> [1] TRUE TRUE  check_coordinates(   latitude = both_invalid_latitude,   longitude = both_invalid_longitude ) #> [1] FALSE FALSE  check_coordinates(   latitude = one_invalid_latitude,   longitude = one_invalid_longitude ) #> [1]  TRUE FALSE

title: Check data
code: check_presence_of_required_columns(df = data_demo_squirrels) #> [1] TRUE

what: Use Case: Filtering and Saving Squirrel Data
title: Use case
text: vignette demonstrates use functions package filter squirrel data based integrity save results separate CSV files.

previous_headings: Use Case: Filtering and Saving Squirrel Data
title: Use case
text: Start loading demo squirrel data included package.
code: data("data_demo_squirrels")

previous_headings: Use Case: Filtering and Saving Squirrel Data
title: Use case
text: Next, apply filter_squirrels_data_based_on_integrity function filter data based integrity. function divides data three categories: valid, invalid, missing.
code: filtered_data <- filter_squirrels_data_based_on_integrity(data_demo_squirrels)

previous_headings: Use Case: Filtering and Saving Squirrel Data
title: Use case
text: Create temporary directory save filtered data use save_as_csv function save category separate CSV files.
code: output_dir <- tempfile() dir.create(output_dir)      save_as_csv(       df = filtered_data$df_valid_data,       path = file.path(output_dir, "valid_data.csv")     ) #> [1] "/tmp/Rtmpy77nlh/file1ec33a3b0880/valid_data.csv"       save_as_csv(       df = filtered_data$df_invalid_data,       path = file.path(output_dir, "invalid_data.csv")     ) #> [1] "/tmp/Rtmpy77nlh/file1ec33a3b0880/invalid_data.csv"      save_as_csv(       df = filtered_data$df_missing_data,       path = file.path(output_dir, "missing_data.csv")     ) #> [1] "/tmp/Rtmpy77nlh/file1ec33a3b0880/missing_data.csv"

title: Exporter les résultats
code: mon_dossier_temp <- tempfile(pattern = "savecsv") dir.create(mon_dossier_temp)  save_as_csv(df = iris, path = file.path(mon_dossier_temp, "output.csv")) #> [1] "/tmp/Rtmpw6T7iC/savecsv1f1e7066f553/output.csv"  unlink(mon_dossier_temp, recursive = TRUE)

what: Get a message with a number of rows in a data frame of interest
title: Get info about the dataset
text: function admits 1 parameter: - df Dataframe. returns message console
code: get_df_nrows(df = iris) #> The dataset is composed of 150 observations #> [1] 150 get_df_nrows(df = mtcars) #> The dataset is composed of 32 observations #> [1] 32

title: Filter the data based on the quality of the primary fur color and the coordinates — filter_squirrels_data_based_on_integrity
text: df_squirrels Data frame. dataset squirrels data.

title: Filter the data based on the quality of the primary fur color and the coordinates — filter_squirrels_data_based_on_integrity
text: list 3 elements (df_valid_data, df_invalid_data, df_missing_data) based integrity (color coordinates)

title: Filter the data based on the quality of the primary fur color and the coordinates — filter_squirrels_data_based_on_integrity
code: data(data_demo_squirrels) filter_squirrels_data_based_on_integrity(data_demo_squirrels) #> $df_valid_data #> # A tibble: 20 × 4 #>     long   lat primary_fur_color type  #>    <dbl> <dbl> <chr>             <chr> #>  1 -74.0  40.8 Gray              valid #>  2 -74.0  40.8 Gray              valid #>  3 -74.0  40.8 Gray              valid #>  4 -74.0  40.8 Cinnamon          valid #>  5 -74.0  40.8 Gray              valid #>  6 -74.0  40.8 Cinnamon          valid #>  7 -74.0  40.8 Cinnamon          valid #>  8 -74.0  40.8 Gray              valid #>  9 -74.0  40.8 Gray              valid #> 10 -74.0  40.8 Cinnamon          valid #> 11 -74.0  40.8 Gray              valid #> 12 -74.0  40.8 Gray              valid #> 13 -74.0  40.8 Gray              valid #> 14 -74.0  40.8 Gray              valid #> 15 -74.0  40.8 Gray              valid #> 16 -74.0  40.8 Gray              valid #> 17 -74.0  40.8 Cinnamon          valid #> 18 -74.0  40.8 Gray              valid #> 19 -74.0  40.8 Gray              valid #> 20 -74.0  40.8 Gray              valid #>  #> $df_invalid_data #> # A tibble: 5 × 4 #>    long   lat primary_fur_color type    #>   <dbl> <dbl> <chr>             <chr>   #> 1 -74.0  50.8 Gray              invalid #> 2 -74.0  50.8 Cinnamon          invalid #> 3 -74.0  50.8 Gray              invalid #> 4 -74.0  50.8 Gray              invalid #> 5 -74.0  50.8 Gray              invalid #>  #> $df_missing_data #> # A tibble: 0 × 4 #> # ℹ 4 variables: long <dbl>, lat <dbl>, primary_fur_color <chr>, type <chr> #>
